item.title: Shabab Lured Kenya Students to Deaths With Promise of Life
item.description: The attack on a Kenyan university that killed almost 150 people exposed how powerless the country is in the face of a ruthless terrorist organization.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY GETTLEMAN
item.media:credit: Carl De Souza/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Students evacuated from Garissa University College at a holding area on Friday. They were to be transported back to their home regions.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Chinese Anti-Graft Activist Plans Lawsuit Over Detention for Prostitution
item.description: Ou Shaokun said that he never paid for sex and that he suspected he was set up by officials trying to smear his reputation.
item.dc:creator: PATRICK BOEHLER and JESS MACY YU

item.title: Germanwings Co-Pilot Accelerated During Descent, Data From 2nd Recorder Shows
item.description: Data showed that Andreas Lubitz used the autopilot to direct the plane to descend to 100 feet, then repeatedly increased the speed.
item.dc:creator: NICOLA CLARK
item.media:credit: Foto Team Mueller/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

item.title: Iran’s Leaders Begin Tricky Task of Selling Nuclear Deal at Home
item.description: In a sign that the plan was broadly supported by the establishment, the government was allowed to promote the virtues of it at Friday Prayer.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: Hundreds welcomed Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif on his return to Tehran on Friday, a day after a nuclear agreement was announced in Switzerland.

item.title: Antitrust and Other Inquiries in Europe Target U.S. Tech Giants
item.description: New developments offer the latest sign that American tech giants face intensifying scrutiny in Europe that could curb their profits in the region and affect how they operate around the world.
item.dc:creator: MARK SCOTT
item.media:description: A commuter wearing Beats headphones in New York. European concerns focus on whether Apple may try to persuade labels to favor its new streaming service over those of rivals.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Use Force to Stop ISIS’ Destruction of Art and History
item.description: Why the world must act to stop ISIS’ acts of cultural annihilation.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: HUGH EAKIN

item.title: Op-Ed Contributors: Solving Libya’s ISIS Problem
item.description: The West must convince the factions to fight the Islamic State instead of each other.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KARIM MEZRAN and MATTIA TOALDO

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Save Bangladesh’s Bloggers
item.description: A series of vicious Islamist-inspired killings threaten the country’s founding principles and very identity.
item.dc:creator: TAHMIMA ANAM

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Xi Jinping’s Sayings Now Available in ‘Little Red App’
item.description: The app is dutifully serious, combining the excitement of watching state television news with the pleasures of reading commentaries on deepening reform.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Zhou Yongkang, Former Security Chief in China, Faces Corruption Trial
item.description: Mr. Zhou, a former member of the powerful Politburo Standing Committee who was in charge of law and order, will be the most senior party official to be tried on graft charges.
item.category: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Zhou Yongkang, the former head of China’s law-and-order apparatus, in Beijing in 2012.

item.title: Open Source: Iranians Celebrate Agreement Online and in the Streets
item.description: Within hours of the deal’s being announced, journalists and bloggers in Iran were sharing glimpses of public and private joy.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: World Briefing: Russia: Death Toll Rises in Ship Disaster
item.description: Russian emergency workers frantically plucked bodies from the freezing Sea of Okhotsk after a refrigerated trawling ship sank off Russia’s Far East, killing at least 56 of a crew of 132.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW ROTH

item.title: World Briefing: India: Gunmen Attack Security Forces
item.description: Five security personnel were killed and seven other people were wounded, officials said.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Myanmar: China Receives an Apology
item.description: Myanmar has apologized for a cross-border bombing last month in which four Chinese farmers were killed.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Report of Missing Israeli in West Bank Proves to Be Hoax
item.description: The Israeli police said that the man reported missing was found in the Jewish settlement of Kiryat Arba equipped with canned food and a sleeping bag.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Congress Responds Cautiously to Framework, and Demands Right to Review Deal
item.description: Senator Bob Corker, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, said the panel would continue with plans to formally draft legislation insisting on congressional examination of any agreement.
item.category: Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN WEISMAN and JENNIFER STEINHAUER
item.media:description: President Obama received an update on the talks with Iran on Wednesday from Secretary of State John Kerry and Energy Secretary Ernest Moniz.

item.title: News Analysis: A Foreign Policy Gamble by Obama at a Moment of Truth
item.description: For a president whose ambitions to remake the world have been repeatedly frustrated, the possibility of a deal with Iran seems within reach, though critics worry that he is giving up too much.
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER

item.title: Iran Agrees to Detailed Nuclear Outline, First Step Toward a Wider Deal
item.description: An understanding was reached about limiting Iran’s nuclear program, but key issues remain before a final agreement in June.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER
item.media:description: From left, the European Union High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, Federica Mogherini; Mohammad Javad Zarif, the Iranian foreign minister; British Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond; and Secretary of State John Kerry at a news conference on Thursday in Lausanne, Switzerland.

item.title: In Tehran, Optimism and Talk of Revival After Nuclear Deal
item.description: Iranians, who had followed news of the nuclear talks closely, began to see a possibility of life without economic sanctions.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:credit: Newsha Tavakolian for The New York Times
item.media:description: News that the framework of a nuclear accord had been reached led to celebration early Friday in Parkway Square in Tehran.

item.title: Somali Militants Kill 147 at Kenyan University
item.description: Shabab militants claimed responsibility for an attack in which gunmen forced their way into dormitories, leaving 147 people dead.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY GETTLEMAN, ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI
item.media:description: Soldiers prepared to enter a building during an attack by gunmen at the university campus in Garissa, Kenya, on Thursday.
